    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • generateNote

        public int generateNote()
        Generates a random piano note of seven possibilities 
 (C,D,E,F,G,A,B) and returns a corresponding integer.
        Returns:
        int 1 if generated note is C int 2 if generated note is D int 3 if generated note is E int 4 if generated note is F int 5 if generated note is G int 6 if generated note is A int 7 if generated note is B Requires the existence of sound files ("C.wav", "D.wav", "E.wav", "F.wav", "G.wav", "A.wav", "B.wav") located in the project resource folder.

      • playBass

        public void playBass()
        Plays a bass drum sound once. Requires the existence of a file named "bass.wav" in the project resource folder.

      • playFile

        public void playFile(java.lang.String filename)
        Plays a a sound file located in the resource folder.
        Parameters:
        filename - The full name of a sound file located in the resource folder of the project.

      • playSnare

        public void playSnare()
        Requires the existence of a file named "snare.wav" in the project resource folder.

      • stopAllFiles

        public void stopAllFiles()
        Stops all the currently playing files.

      • stopFile

        public void stopFile()
         Stops the playing of the first file that was being played
 for example: if user played file1 then file2 then file3.
 If the user calls this method, file1 will be stopped.
 If the user calls the method again, then file2 will be stopped.
 If the user calls the method a third time, then file3 will be stopped.

      • stopFile

        public void stopFile(java.lang.String filename)
        Stops the playing of a specific file.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to be stopped.

      • waitEighth

        public void waitEighth()
        (r) Used to add a time gap of an eighth of a second after playing a sound.

      • waitSecond

        public void waitSecond()
        (r) Used to add a time gap of 1 second after playing a sound.

      • waitHalf

        public void waitHalf()
        (r) Used to add a time gap of half a second after playing a sound.

      • waitQuarter

        public void waitQuarter()
        (r) Used to add a time gap of a quarter of a second after playing a sound.

      • wait

        public void wait(int milliseconds)

      • playPianoNote

        public void playPianoNote(int index)
         Used to play a piano note.
        Parameters:
        index - note value between 1 and 7. plays a C note if index = 1. plays a D note if index = 2. plays a E note if index = 3. plays a F note if index = 4. plays a G note if index = 5. plays a A note if index = 6. plays a B note if index = 7.
